StartDragging

public void StartDragging(HitPoint hp)
Description copied from class: exCanvas
StartDragging is called from the default version of exCanvas.MouseMotion(int, int, online.common.OnlineConstants.mouseState) when the mouse button is down and the mouse moves, or when the mouse button is released (possibly without being moved). The intended interface for your canvas to use StartDragging to trigger events which involve picking up and moving an object.

Specified by:
StartDragging in class exCanvas
See Also:
exCanvas.StopDragging(online.common.HitPoint)

StopDragging

public void StopDragging(HitPoint hp)
Description copied from class: exCanvas
StopDragging is called when the mouse button transitions from down to up. The intended interface is to use StopDragging to trigger clicks on buttons and other objects that do not move.

Specified by:
StopDragging in class exCanvas
See Also:
exCanvas.StartDragging(online.common.HitPoint)

MouseMotion

public HitPoint MouseMotion(int ex0,
                            int ey0,
                            OnlineConstants.mouseState upcode)
Description copied from class: exCanvas
This is called from the viewer event loop when there is any mouse activity that needs to be handled. The mechanics guarantee that every "down" will be matches by an "up", and every down or up will be followed by a "move".

Overrides:
MouseMotion in class exCanvas
Parameters:
ex0 - is the mouse x
ey0 - is the mouse y
upcode - is an integer code indicating the state of the mouse, one of OnlineConstants.mouseState

DoMouseExited

public void DoMouseExited()
Description copied from class: exCanvas
handle mouse exiting the window. This method just registers that the mouse is inactive, and wakes the event loop.

Specified by:

ViewerRun

public void ViewerRun(int wait)
Description copied from class: exCanvas
this is the run loop for the window. All significant events should occur here. Actions due to network, mouse, or keyboard should be deferred and handled here. Canvas painting is also deferred and handles here.

About the only thing that doesn't happen here is activity by robots to search for next moves.

Specified by:
ViewerRun in interface CanvasProtocol
Overrides:
ViewerRun in class exCanvas
See Also:
exCanvas.handleDeferredEvent(java.lang.Object), RepaintManager.paintCanvas(java.awt.Graphics, boolean, online.common.HitPoint)

public boolean handleDeferredEvent(java.lang.Object otarget)
Description copied from class: exCanvas
handle an event that was deferred. This is a visitor method to handle menu items, both fixed and popup.

Specified by:
handleDeferredEvent in interface DeferredEventHandler
Overrides:
handleDeferredEvent in class exCanvas
Parameters:
otarget - the object that was target of the menu event
Returns:
true if the event was handled.
